this.$debug
If debug is true, this will be the jQuery object for the visible rectangle.
We keep track of whether the tabs are hidden in this (internal) variable so we still have access to that information during the window’s unload event, when window.Tabs no longer exists.
this.bounds
The position and size of this Item, represented as a Rect.
A getter that yields the toolbar button for direct manipulation.
this.container
The outermost DOM element that describes this item on screen.
this.debug
When set to true, displays a rectangle on the screen that corresponds with bounds.
this.isAnItem
Always true for Items
this.locked
Affects whether an item can be pushed, closed, renamed, etc
How to deal when things go off the edge.
set unread(
   val
){ this._unreadCount = parseInt(val); this._render(); }, get unread(){ return this._unreadCount; } } context.Toolbar
A getter/setter that allows you to get/set the number of “unread” tabs.
